articles.title: Kim Jong Un Congratulates Lao Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Congratulates Lao Party Leader
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, sent a congratulatory message to Bounnhang Vorachith, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP), on Wednesday.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend hearty congratulations and comradely salute to you and, through you, to the Central Committee of the LPRP and all your party members on the occasion of its 63rd founding anniversary.
					
					 Over the past 63 years the LPRP has led the Lao people and registered great successes in the struggle to build a people's democratic system, defend the revolutionary gains and achieve the independent development and prosperity of the country.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I sincerely wish you good health and your party bigger successes in its activities to implement the decision of its 10th Congress, expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between our two parties and two peoples would steadily grow stronger in the common struggle for socialism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Ko Su Yong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Ko Su Yong
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un sent a wreath to the bier of Merited Artist Ko Su Yong, a composer of the National Symphony Orchestra, on Wednesday, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Iran
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Iran
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Hassan Rouhani, president of the Islamic Republic of Iran, on the occasion of the New Year of Iran. 
					 Kim Yong Nam in the message wished happiness and prosperity to the government and people of Iran, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries with a long history and tradition would grow stronger in the common interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: Greetings to Iranian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Iranian Foreign Minister
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho Wednesday sent a message of greeting to his Iranian counterpart Mohammad Javad Zarif on the occasion of the New Year of Iran.
					 The message expressed belief that cooperation between the foreign ministries would strengthen in the work to expand the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries and build a just and peaceful new world.

articles.title: Vice-Premier Meets Russian Delegation
articles.content:
Vice-Premier Meets Russian Delegation
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet and chairman of the State Planning Commission, had a talk with the Russian government economic delegation headed by Alexandr Galushka, minister of Development of Far East who is chairman of the Russian side to the DPRK-Russia intergovernmental committee for cooperation in trade, economy and science and technology, which paid a courtesy call on him at the People's Palace of Culture on Wednesday.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Russian Minister
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Russian Minister
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the minister of Development of Far East of the Russian Federation.
					 The gift was conveyed to Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier and chairman of the State Planning Commission, on Wednesday by Minister of Development of Far East Alexandr Galushka, chairman of the Russian side to the DPRK-Russia intergovernmental committee for cooperation in trade, economy and science and technology who is heading the Russian government economic delegation on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: 8th Meeting of DPRK-Russia Intergovernmental Committee for Cooperation
articles.content:
8th Meeting of DPRK-Russia Intergovernmental Committee for Cooperation
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The 8th meeting of the DPRK-Russia intergovernmental committee for cooperation in trade, economy, science and technology took place at the People's Palace of Culture Wednesday.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Minister of External Economic Relations Kim Yong Jae, chairman of the DPRK side to the committee, and officials concerned and from the Russian side were members of the Russian government economic delegation led by Minister of Development of Far East Alexandr Galushka, chairman of the Russian side to the committee, and Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Alexandr Matsegora.
					
					 The meeting discussed the matters of boosting the bilateral cooperation in trade, economy, science and technology.
					
					 That day a reception for the Russian delegation was given at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel.

articles.title: Protocol Inked between DPRK, Russia
articles.content:
Protocol Inked between DPRK, Russia
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- A protocol of the 8th meeting of the DPRK-Russia inter-governmental committee for cooperation in trade, economy, science and technology was signed at the People's Palace of Culture on Wednesday.
					 Present at the signing ceremony were Kim Yong Jae, minister of External Economic Relations who is chairman of the DPRK side to the committee, and officials concerned and the members of the Russian government economic delegation led by Alexandr Galushka, minister of Development of Far East who is chairman of the Russian side to the committee, and Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 Kim Yong Jae and Alexandr Galushka signed the protocol.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Russian government economic delegation led by Minister of Development of Far East Alexandr Galushka, chairman of the Russian side to the DPRK-Russia intergovernmental committee for cooperation in trade, economy and science and technology, Wednesday visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill.
					 The members of the delegation laid bouquets before the statues of the great leaders and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Visits Liberation Tower
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Visits Liberation Tower
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- A Russian government economic delegation headed by Alexandr Galushka, minister of Development of Far East who is chairman of the Russian side to the DPRK-Russia intergovernmental committee for cooperation in trade, economy and science and technology, visited the Liberation Tower on Wednesday.
					 It was accompanied by officials concerned and the Russian ambassador to the DPRK and his embassy officials.
					
					 The visitors laid bouquets before the tower and observed a moment's silence in memory of the fallen soldiers of the Soviet Army.
					
					 The delegation also toured the Jongbaek Church on the same day.

articles.title: World Water Day Observed in DPRK
articles.content:
World Water Day Observed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- A workshop took place at the Grand People's Study House here on Wednesday to observe World Water Day for 2018.
					 Present there were officials of relevant units including the Ministry of Urban Management and the Grand People's Study House and members of UNDP, UNICEF, WHO, the mission of the European Union Programme Support, the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation here and a delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies working in the DPRK.
					
					 Speakers at the workshop referred to the efforts made by the DPRK government to preserve water resource and put its management and use on a rational way.
					
					 They underscored the need to intensify the preservation of natural environment on a worldwide scale so as to settle the serious water issue arising in many countries and regions.
					
					 The participants watched a TV program and photos on the securement and sustained use of water, a precious natural resource vital for existence and development of mankind.

articles.title: Fish Farming Brisk
articles.content:
Fish Farming Brisk
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- It has been pushed forward to breed fish on a large scale in the DPRK.
					 Taking the lead in it is South Hwanghae Province of which all city and county spawning stations have made the preparations for mass-producing fries after securing enough herbivorous mother fishes.
					
					 More fish farms have been built and spawning stations and fish-breeding grounds repaired or maintained to fit for ecological characteristics of fish.
					
					 All fish farms built cage-net fish-breeding grounds and loach ponds while growing good species of fries and feeding in a scientific way.
					
					 Deep attention has been paid to protecting and multiplying fries of silver carp, Ryongjong fish, Aristichythys nobilis and other fishes in natural fish-breeding areas. And facilities have been set to collect spawns of pond smelt, carp and goldfish, and fries released into natural fish-breeding areas.
					
					 Catfish culture also gins momentum in the province.

articles.title: Timber Supply to Construction Sites to Wonsan-Kalma Area Increased
articles.content:
Timber Supply to Construction Sites to Wonsan-Kalma Area Increased
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Thousands of cubic meters of timber have been produced and sent to the construction sites in the Wonsan-Kalma coastal tourist area of the DPRK.
					 The Ministry of Forestry and provincial forestry management bureaus encouraged forestry stations and mine-pillar producers to introduce effective cutting methods and ensure the full operation of vehicles for increased timber production.
					
					 Forestry stations under the Ryanggang, Jagang and North Hamgyong provincial forestry management bureaus have boosted the production by applying effective method to shortening the time of loading and unloading timbers.
					
					 Meanwhile, the ministry took due measures to timely supply timber to the construction sites in close cooperation with the Ministry of Railways.

articles.title: Popular Uprising on Jeju Island
articles.content:
Popular Uprising on Jeju Island
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- It was on April 3, 1948, 70 years ago, that a popular armed uprising was launched on Jeju Island of south Korea to oppose the "May 10 separate elections" by the U.S. imperialists and the Syngman Rhee puppet clique.
					 Jeju islanders turned out in the uprising at the signal of a torch on Mt Halla at 02:00 that day and bravely struggled against the U.S. imperialists and the Syngman Rhee puppet clique, shouting such slogans as "Resolute opposition to the separate elections and separate government" and "Long live national reunification!"
					
					 Much upset by this, the U.S. imperialists and their stooges scorched 295 villages or more than half of the island and cruelly killed at least 70,000 innocent people by mobilizing huge forces in a repressive operation. Anyhow, the "May 10 separate elections" on Jeju Island ended in failure.
					
					 The popular uprising on Jeju Island, a righteous anti-U.S. resistance for national salvation, displayed the unanimous desire and indomitable stamina of the south Korean people to reject the interference of foreign forces and achieve the independent reunification and sovereignty of the country after its liberation. So, people from all walks of life in south Korea are still holding events in memory of the victims on the anniversary of the uprising.
					
					 But the U.S. has not yet apologized for the massacre on the island and the conservative group tries to play down the historic significance of the uprising, calling it a "rebellion by the order of the north."
					
					 This is another unpardonable crime designed to justify their thrice-cursed crime and keep it buried into oblivion of history.
					
					 The south Korean people have been subjected to untold sufferings owing to the U.S. imperialists, chieftain of national division, and the conservative traitors who have flattered and yielded to them.
					
					 The U.S. imperialist aggressor forces massacred more than one million patriots and innocent people before the Korean War after the August 15 liberation of Korea. And they mercilessly killed at least 1.24 million peaceable residents across south Korea including Rogun-ri, Yongdong County, North Chungchong Province and Sinwon-myon, Kochang County, South Kyongsang Province during the three-year Korean War.
					
					 After the war, the U.S. has backed the brutal suppression of the struggle of the south Korean people aspiring after independence, democracy and reunification such as the April 19 popular uprising and the May 18 Kwangju popular uprising and encouraged the conservative group, a group of rare-to-be-seen fascists, in the operation to suppress  the uprisings.
					
					 As was recently disclosed, the conservative group hatched a plot to suppress by the force of arms even the candlelight demonstrations of the south Korean people launched to oust traitor Park Geun Hye from power.
					
					 The conservative forces of south Korea had committed shocking atrocities in a bid to strengthen their system for domination and dictatorship and engaged themselves in smear campaigns such as "total denial" and the "north wind".
					
					 But, as was disclosed in 2000 that "evidence" related to the popular uprising on Jeju Island was cooked up by the Central Intelligence Agency, the schemes and atrocities of the U.S. and conservative group have been revealed with the passage of time.
					
					 The "Liberal Korea Party" and other conservative forces are remnants of the pro-U.S. stooges who brutally massacred the people on the island while acting as servants of the U.S. imperialists and turned south Korea into a graveyard of independence and democracy and a veritable hell. They are now striving for the revival of the pro-U.S. dictatorial rule, maliciously slandering the popular uprising on Jeju Island.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean conservatives are a group of the worst murderers and traitors in history, who leave no stone unturned to realize their criminal purposes.
					
					 All the facts show that neither national reunification nor genuine democracy in south Korean society can be realized with the U.S. and conservative group left intact.
					
					 In order to realize the aspiration of the martyrs of Jeju Island, the cherished desire of the nation, it is necessary to reject the domination and interference of foreign forces and resolutely smash pro-U.S. traitors' sycophancy and confrontation moves against the fellow countrymen. 
					
					 Written by Ri Kyong Ju.

articles.title: Imprisonment of Lee Myung Bak Urged
articles.content:
Imprisonment of Lee Myung Bak Urged
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean online paper Minjok Ilbo on Mar. 18 carried an editorial calling for the imprisonment of traitor Lee Myung Bak and the dissolution of the "Liberal Korea Party" which is backing the traitor.
					 The editorial noted that Lee denied most of the charges when he was under the prosecution's investigation, claiming that the controversial company is not his and he had never been involved in its operation.
					
					 Not only the ruling party but also opposition parties are demanding the imprisonment and investigation of the traitor, it said, charging that the "Liberal Korea Party" alone is protecting him.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Printed in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Printed in Bulgaria
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's work "War Veterans Are Our Precious Revolutionary Forerunners Who Created the Indomitable Spirit of Defending the Country" was brought out in booklet by the Zaraba Publishing House of Bulgaria on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the Day of the Sun.
					 The work, a congratulatory speech the Supreme Leader made on July 25, Juche 104 (2015), says that July 27 of Korea is the day of second liberation when the country's dignity and sovereignty were honorably defended from the U.S. imperialists' aggression and the holiday of victors who put the U.S. imperialists on a downhill march towards ruin. 
					
					 It stresses that the fighting spirit and patriotic feats of the war veterans who dedicated their whole life to the country's independent reunification and prosperity would be eternally recorded in the history of the Korean people's heroic struggle.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Brazil
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Brazil
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- A Brazilian preparatory committee for celebrating the 106th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was formed on Mar. 13.
					 Rosanita Campos, vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to give wide publicity to the sacred revolutionary career and feats of the President through media and organize a celebration meeting, seminar, film show and other political and cultural events on the occasion of the anniversary.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion a Bounnhang Vorachith
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Congratulates Lao Party Leader
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, sent a congratulatory message to Bounnhang Vorachith, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP), on Wednesday.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend hearty congratulations and comradely salute to you and, through you, to the Central Committee of the LPRP and all your party members on the occasion of its 63rd founding anniversary.
					
					 Over the past 63 years the LPRP has led the Lao people and registered great successes in the struggle to build a people's democratic system, defend the revolutionary gains and achieve the independent development and prosperity of the country.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I sincerely wish you good health and your party bigger successes in its activities to implement the decision of its 10th Congress, expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between our two parties and two peoples would steadily grow stronger in the common struggle for socialism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Ko Su Yong
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Visits Liberation Tower
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- A Russian government economic delegation headed by Alexandr Galushka, minister of Development of Far East who is chairman of the Russian side to the DPRK-Russia intergovernmental committee for cooperation in trade, economy and science and technology, visited the Liberation Tower on Wednesday.
					 It was accompanied by officials concerned and the Russian ambassador to the DPRK and his embassy officials.
					
					 The visitors laid bouquets before the tower and observed a moment's silence in memory of the fallen soldiers of the Soviet Army.
					
					 The delegation also toured the Jongbaek Church on the same day.

Vice-Premier Meets Russian Delegation
